review_text: We absolutely loved this location in Mount Vernon, beautiful setting in the historic district, close to downtown, walkable to many restaurants and if you get a chance to visit the dog fountain, itâ€™s our favorite. This house was clearly a love of labor as you can tell itâ€™s an older home and has been restored and renovated with the most incredible features and updates for todayâ€™s renters. Beautiful restored original hardwood floors, they saved old school details such as exposed brick and hardwood plus molding throughout but also added amazing modern features and the comfort level is incredible. I absolutely loved the old doors and original handles restored to their natural look. The bathroom with soaking tub was exquisite. The front porch is a perfect place to relax and enjoy your morning coffee or an evening glass of wine. We also loved all the puppies in the neighborhood. I could go on but do yourself a favor and book a stay, itâ€™s amazing.

The dining room table was the perfect size for playing games. Although weather prevented us from doing so, downtown Mt. Vernon is within walking distance. The short and easy drive to Kenyon College was greatly appreciated. Thank you again for a wonderful stay and we look forward to returning!

He had a great welcome note for our family and a folder full of info and local recommendations that we really appreciated. The snacks and coffee options were the cherry on top, along with the laundry soap and bathroom items he supplied. It was an amazing stay, and we are big fans of his place! Thank you, Jim!

Stayed with kids
review_text:
We had a wonderful stay at Jimâ€™s place. Check in was a breeze, and everything in the home is labeled and easy to find. Our group consisted of grandparents, parents, and a 2 year old. Knowing this, Jim put out some toys, high chair, and a pack and play for our use. My mother made a big family dinner, and everything she could have needed was there. My brother came in from Columbus and we shared a 3-course meal like old days.
Beds were comfy, lots of extra pillows, great water pressure and the towels were so fluffy! Mom again made breakfast and grandpa and I took the little one for a nice walk to Mount Vernon downtown. The neighborhood is gorgeous and historic, and everyone was so friendly. There was a farmers market at public square, and we picked up a wildflower bouquet for Alise/grandma. Stopped at the happy bean coffee shop, and saw the dog foundation on our way back.
It was only one night but we had such a good time with our family. I also fell in looooove with the town of Mount Vernon. Wonderful breweries and restaurants in the areaâ€¦I really canâ€™t wait to come back. Cheers to a wonderful stay and a great host! Thanks again.

We were visiting Kenyon College for our daughter. Driving across the country, not really knowing what to expect in a new state and town. Everything in Jim's description of the property was accurate. Mount Vernon is a charming town, and the home is located in the Historic section. Many beautiful homes with period details, brick roads, huge front porches, we took many walks in the morning and in the evening just to take it all in. The house is a comfortable, spacious, 4 square design with high ceilings, and ample rooms. Beds are very comfortable, a million little details all thought out in advance, notes on the area, info on attractions, brochures..etc..Jim has thought of everything. The home is meticulously clean and it truly felt like we were staying at a relative's home! Games for the kids, charming outdoor patio with hanging bistro lights. Full size washer and dryer, dishwasher..fully stocked kitchen, and a very attentive and thoughtful host.
We will be staying here again!! Thank you Jim for a wonderful stay in Mount Vernon!

The house, in general, was amazingly clean, enough for us to walk around barefoot. However, we felt that the downstairs bathroom could have been cleaner. That said, it's so negligible compared to all the good that's going on - it's definitely one of the best places we've stayed.
We were only passing through for one night, but have marked this place as a go-to if we're ever in the area again!

review_text: The Galerie Suite is a perfect getaway in a great little town, Mt Vernon. Exceptionally clean, beautifully decorated, and truly a unique place to stay. Yummy treats left for us by the host in the refrigerator, too! It reminded me so much of my grandmother's building/home in New Jersey, which they occupied in the early 1900's... a skinny building with many floors and great antiques. The bed we slept in was very comfortable. The street is a little noisy, but the host had earplugs handy if necessary. We did not end up needing them - it's a city. We are accustomed to street noise. We were traveling on our bicycles on the OTET and the Galleria Suite is very close to the trail. Easy off, easy on! The patio is lovely and a perfect safe place for our bicycles. I highly recommend the Galerie Suite to all travelers, bicycles or not!

The amenities offered added such a sweet spin to an already unique experience of this accommodating and comfortable arrangement. The family's Parisian style apartment was meticulously maintained to offer a travel friendly, clean, and downright charming stay.
We are grateful for having found such a place to stay and would be happy to come back and visit again!
Sincerely, from a mother and daughter, our tales of the Coleman Family Suites

My wife & I traveled to Mt. Vernon, Ohio from Vermont to visit our youngest daughter at Kenyon College and attend two of her field hockey games. The Galerie Suite was a perfect fit for our two-night stay as it provided the extra living space you can't get from a hotel. We prepared home cooked meals in the quaint kitchen and ate them on the lovely private outdoor patio. Our daughter stayed with us for the two nights in the second bedroom - getting a break from the dorm room and cafeteria food. We also spent some quality time catching up while relaxing in the cozy living room. Vicki was an awesome host (as reflected by other testimonials)! You can't beat the personal touches she provided. Parking, location and walkability were added perks. We will be back!
- Pam, Mike & Molly

Vickie met us when we arrived and gave us a tour. She is wonderful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The location is within walking distance of quite a few restaurants, and the dog fountain is across the street. If you are on the fence about staying here, jump off and do it. You will love it.

The third floor is a smaller bedroom, sitting area and fully functional kitchen. (Both bedrooms have double beds.) I appreciated the separation in space since I'm up earlier than the rest and could make coffee and read without waking everyone. The place is even more quaint than it looks in the pictures. It's really welcoming and lovely, and very well appointed. Vicki provided everything we could think to need- including scones and wine :) The private courtyard patio is another great space to sit and relax- very peaceful. The airbnb is on Main Street historic Mt. Vernon. So, there are lots of choices for food and shopping without having to drive. We stayed at Vicki's place for a couple of days for a wedding. My only regret is that we didn't have a full day to just stay there and relax!

review_text:
We loved it here! My daughter and I stayed for one night. We had a great time here. The location is perfect right in the downtown area. Hosts were very nice and hospitable. The value and price is unbeatable. They also provided small notes around the house regarding different things we needed to know about the house or appliances. They had a list of local restaurants and businesses for us to look at as well which was very helpful.
-The beds were very comfortable.
-Plenty of toiletries and small items were very handy. We didn't need any of them but if you forgot something they were very convenient.
-Many pillows and blankets if you need them.
-Lots of towels are a big plus!
-Kitchen was fantastic. We loved the provided treats (eggs, scones, bread) and enjoyed spending time in the kitchen.
-Mini TV worked well.
-WiFi worked with no issues.
-Thermostat was easily adjustable.
-Bathroom was nice. Shower looked great. We didn't use it but it looked very cool.
There are plenty of steep stairs, so if you have any knee/mobility issues that is good to know.
Would stay again!

review_text: This apartment is absolutely charming and unique covering two floors and has a delightful Parisian feel full of wonderful artwork throughout! So well-appointed and thoughtfully planned, they have fresh treats and wine in the fridge awaiting you, brochures of the local area, and a kitchen and bathroom with everything you could ever imagine needing during your stay. The two bedrooms provide nice beds with lovely duvets covers that are very comfy. The location is perfect for easy walking to restaurants, coffee shops and galleries and only a 10-minute drive down Gambier Rd. to get to Kenyon College, if that's your aim. (The only downside is the somewhat loud traffic noise of pickup trucks at night and early morning, but they even provide ear plugs next to each bed for this.) There's also a little furnished patio if the weather allows for outdoor sitting. The hosts are great communicators providing clear directions, and they're also wonderful artists, inviting you to visit their beautiful gallery next story while you're staying there. Our very strong recommendation!

Stayed one night
review_text: I enjoyed my one night stay in the apartment after spending the morning at the Schnormeier Gardens. This Airbnb is creatively designed, appealing to the eye and makes great use of all available spaces. The Gallery Suite is comfortable and functional and beautifully done. Vicki was readily available and no issues with the key pad entry. Thank you Vicki, for making it possible for me to check in earlier. That made the day flow perfectly. The only thing I would inform others of is that most of the businesses /restaurants are not open Sunday. The pub just up the street was open but a long wait for a table. I didn't realize I would need a reservation. But that does not take away from the time well spent in the apartment. Vicki is a generous host who had supplied the fridge with a bottle of wine, cheese, eggs, some incredible scones and a loaf of bread. I appreciated that greatly and would be happy to return another time.

name: Terilyn
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Our stay at the Galerie Suite in downtown Mount Vernon, OH was really wonderful and we happily recommend staying here. Vicki provided a number of thoughtful touches to make us comfortable such as a bottle of wine, delicious mini scones, sour dough bread, cheese, and fresh eggs. The beds were very comfortable and we all slept well.
The apartment's location is especially wonderful for exploring the shops and restaurants downtown Mount Vernon. We especially recommend trying out th Alcove, Stein Brewing, the North Main Cafe, and the Happy Bean coffee shop (right across the street). We stayed over a weekend, so we were in close walking distance to the farmers market in the square on Saturday morning. Our two year old son was thrilled to be so close to the dog fountain across the street and we made many, many visits to see it.
Vicki did a wonderful job communicating with us and answered our questions quickly.
We will definitely be staying with Vicki again on our next visit to Mount Vernon.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Vicki was very easy to communicate with, as well as a very thoughtful host. My friend and I met up for a weekend in Mount Vernon, and this place was the perfect size for us 2. The Airbnb is located downtown with close access to several restaurants, breweries, and cute, family run shops. There a several parks within biking/walking distance, with access to a great bike trail close by. There's even a bike rental place right around the corner. My only advice to people coming in from out of town to stay here is to look ahead at restaurant/shop hours. Many are closed on Sundays so if there is a specific place you would like to see try to plan around that :) A great place to visit for a quiet, relaxing weekend.

name: Rachel

Stayed with kids
review_text: We loved staying here. It was perfect for our family of four. Lots of thoughtful touches in the kitchen, an electric kettle, lots of tea, a Keurig, fridge stocked with some snacks and fresh eggs from a local farm. Everything was very comfortable and pleasant. I would absolutely stay here again. Two things to keep in mind: one, there are a lot of stairs, just in case that's an issue for you (not for us -- I thought that was a benefit, separating our level from where our kids slept! wahoo!) and two, the path to the bathroom is through one of the bedrooms, so that would have been frustrating I think if we were two separate families, but for us it wasn't a problem. I loved the loads of clean towels. This place was very clean and the beds were comfortable, which I cannot say about all airbnbs. Vicki was very attentive to detail. Also, very close to lots of cute things in Mount Vernon. Wonderful!

I didn't fully understand the suite part of the listing where one bedroom wouldn't have a door nor did I understand the apartment would have a small opening to the back desk of the gallery during the day without a way to lock the apartment space. Other than wishing I would have read that somewhere, everything else met and somewhat exceeded expectations.

review_text: This space was everything we couldâ€™ve asked for and more. My boyfriend and I took a trip to Mt. Vernon for a family wedding, and after seeing the air BnB we didnâ€™t want to leave lol. Vicki was extremely prompt and helpful with the questions we had prior to arriving, letting us check in early, and check out when was most convenient for us the next day. She even asked our wine preference, being sure to stock the fridge with wine and plenty of food for us (which came in handy for breakfast the next morning lol). The space she has created for her guests are sure to leave you with a beautiful memory and a great time in this quaint little town. The space is just above a trendy little gallery, and in the center of the town. She provided an extremely modern large back patio leading up to the house. The house is absolutely beautiful, and vintage, with elements from the Victorian era, added with the modern updates, this place is everything one could ask for and more during a trip to this beautifully historic town. Thank you again Vicki for making our weekend trip one we wonâ€™t soon forget.

review_text: This is a very comfortable and stylish place--in an "antique-y" kind of way. Vicki is a super host. Everything that you can imagine needing always seemed to be right there at our fingertips, from kitchen and cooking stuff to towels and soap and shampoo, to pillows and blankets. She even provided wine and cheese, bread, coffee, and more. The apartment is lovely and clean, with a nice European/French feel. The bathroom is new and modern, with a marble shower. There are stairs to climb that could be an issue for some, but wasn't for us. The location is right in the middle of downtown, so everything is walking distance. When we return to Mount Vernon, we will stay at Vicki & Robert's place.

I finally got to and it did not disappoint! Every little detail made it special and made us feel like 5 star guests. The Parisian style makes you feel like you're in Europe! It does not have a TV because is more of a place to go to get away from the craziness and relax-- read a book and drink a glass of wine. We definitely recommend and hope we can come back someday!

It is warm, and welcoming, and makes you feel like you are at your "home away from home". Vicki thinks of everything. From the homemade treats to the wine to the bed linens. The Galerie is in an ideal location to downtown Mt Vernon restaurants and shops, and an easy 5 minute drive to Kenyon College. If you are looking to stay somewhere that feels like home, and to have a host that makes you feel comfortable enough to kick your shoes off and relax, this is the place. We will definately look to Vicki and her Galerie Suite first when returning to visit our son. Thank you Vicki!

The gallery downstairs is lovely and filled with interesting art made by Vicki, her husband and her four talented grown children. Then, upstairs, the apartment is a work of art too! It's decorated beautifully and very comfortably! Lots of interesting little touches - loved the lace curtain in the bathroom and the curtain in the kitchen, as well as the cute eclectic furnishings. (Really I'd love for Vicki to come and decorate my house!) And, to top it all off, Vicki left us homemade bread & muffins, butter, jam, and fresh eggs. So we were able to make ourselves a delicious breakfast in the morning!
Beds were comfy and there was plenty of light for reading in bed. Vicki really thought of everything!

This is a really cool space, classy and quirky at the same time with a cute kitchen upstairs and a great granite shower in the bathroom. We had everything we needed and more.
The only thing is that if you need dark, dark in order to sleep well you might want to bring a sleeping mask, because being in town (on a relatively quiet street) enough light comes in through the pretty stained glass windows that it seems like almost dawn even in the middle of the night.
This would be a great deal for two couples traveling together.

I had the privilege of staying at LuAnnâ€™s property last night as I began a bike trip from Columbus to Cleveland and back. I had some unexpected issues getting started and LuAnn was very flexible with the later arrival (9:30pm) and everything was self check in
The property was absolutely perfect and exactly as described. Completely spotless inside, nice comfortable bed, a couple beverages (soda, coffee, water) and snacks/light breakfast available (granola bars and oatmeal) as self serve just steps from the bedroom door.
LuAnn offered a secure location to store my eBike and trailer overnight that was out of the elements just in case of rain which was greatly appreciated. I was able to get an awesome hot shower in, have a good nights sleep, and hit the trail refreshed this morning thanks to how refreshing my stay was at LuAnnâ€™s property was last night.
Highly recommend this host, especially for those riding the Ohio to Erie Trail!

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a lovely, clean place with a comfortable bed and linens, great outdoor spaces, and THREE TVs. However, we were not expecting it to be in the basement. (We knew that many homes in this hilly area have ground level walk-in entrances, and this is what we expected.) We had traveled from Florida, stopped for 5 nights to visit family and then headed to Wis. for several months. Because of this we had a lot of foodstuffs and medication that required freezing and refrigerating. But the "refrigerator" turned out to be only a mini-fridge. Todd was quick to help carry our large, heavy cooler down the stairs and offered to freeze whatever we needed. (Thanks again!) Another disadvantage of basement living is that guests have no control over the room temperature, other than closing the vents, which helped a little. If you don't mind stairs (watch your head!), a small mini-fridge and limited kitchen area, and like it cool, then this is a great place for you. It was nicely furnished and stocked with snacks, drinks, bathroom items, etc. and Toby and LuAnn are very accommodating.

Actually wish we spent more time at the property.

Overall a quiet place.
We had gravel race in Homer, so this was a convenient location for the night before.
Host sent instructions a few days before and was responsive when I had questions.
Thank you for the late check out so that we could freshen up before the drive home.
Would stay here again.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I stayed at Barb's place for several days while delivering my daughter to Kenyon for her first year of college. I can't say enough about what a gracious, warm, helpful, accommodating, helpful, and communicative host Barb is! When we drove up on the windy back roads I thought we were in the middle of nowhere and hopelessly far away from everything, but it's really just a few minutes drive to Kenyon College and/or Mount Vernon and it's so nice to come back to this beautiful, quiet, and peaceful respite at the end of a busy day. (That said, I would try to arrive during daylight hours on your first visit!) My daughter and I loved the apartment, which was spotless and very well equipped. The couch is very comfortable, the TV and WiFi work well, and the apartment is spacious for two people. I enjoyed hiking at nearby Brown Family Environmental Center and sitting out front to read and watch the sun go down. I look forward to exploring the area more on my next visit. I liked it so much that I immediately wanted to book it for Family Weekend in October, but was too late. Highly recommend. I will be back to Barb's airbnb!

She went on to say that, "Sometimes hearing a friendly voice on the other line can calm your fears." She knew exactly what I was feeling and was a very thoughtful gesture to extend to me.
She and Bill made my stay in Gambier wonderful. I got to see some snow fall, a rare sight in Southern California. I loved their place - very spacious and welcoming. We will definitely be back in May. Thank you, Bill and Barbara, for a wonderful stay in the countryside.
Best,
~ Rowenna

review_text: Terrific property at an affordable price. "Ordinary Manor, Too" has a spacious living room and bedroom and bath and full kitchen. Fine for a family of 3 or 4. I visited the property with my daughter and we had plenty of space. There is also a porch/deck in the back. The area is very quiet, (and dark at nighttime!), 2-3 miles from Gambier-Kenyon College, going on a few back roads. I think its an especially great property for a couple or family who want to have some meals at home because it is spacious and because of the full kitchen, and good for anyone visiting Kenyon, as I was. Barbara was highly responsive and is obviously interested in having her guests have a good experience. The place was immaculate and I would definitely stay there again.
